item.title: Broken bike near footpath, 17th June
item.description:
A bike has been vandalised (in 2 parts) and dumped in the wooded area just off the footpath after the boardwalk. If EWOS is entered from the bottom of Glenmore and the path followed past the boardwalk continuing in the wooded area the pieces are on the left. Or were this morning.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Radial Path, East Wickham, London

item.title: Corner of Kelly Avenue and Watts Street constantly full of rubbish all over the street, 17th June
item.description:
Constantly flytipping problem, absolutely unacceptable, health hazard for residents We complained numerous times but unfortunately it's ongoing problem and something really efficient must be done We cannot call council every other day to complain about rubbish all over the place Please do something effective.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Watts Street, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking slot, 17th June
item.description:
This car been parked for several months car park slot belongs to house number 10 vehicle badly damaged, for safety reasons this car have to be removed, please remove this vehicle this is not a scrap yard, no tax no insurance no mot
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Tuppy Street, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mean leaving dog poo under bench, 17th June
item.description:
At approx 9 a.m. this morning, I challenged a man who I believe was wearing a blue top and shorts with a small black pug on the lead. I was running with a black top white shorts and white shoes, and challenge the man on the fact he watched his dog do a poo, and then walked off leaving it right under a bench which I view is unacceptable. The reason I described both myself the man and the dog, is that it was right in front of one of the recently installed cameras within Sutcliffe Park as indicated by the map positioning. I didn’t get a name, only briefly told the man that it was ridiculous that he was out with no poo bags and he could not care in the slightest. Not sure what can be done, but thought it was worth reporting it was somewhat frustrating.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17-23, Dowding Drive, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Small trees are dying of thirst, 17th June
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mayfield Close, Hackney, London

item.title: Water leak thanes water, 17th June
